Metoprolol is also used to treat heart failure, but indapamide may exacerbate hypokalemia, which can worsen heart failure symptoms. Amlodipine is a calcium channel blocker and is not typically used as first-line therapy for heart failure. Valsartan and spironolactone may be used in certain cases of heart failure, but the patient is already taking torsemide, a loop diuretic, and adding another diuretic such as spironolactone may lead to electrolyte imbalances.
